description.narrative: Contribute to the improvement of sustainable rural livelihoods and to food security in Latin America, through the provision of first-rate, practice-relevant higher education to students of poor socio-economic background with high academic and leadership potential in the public, private and CSO sectors. (1) Provide students of poor socio-economic background of selected Latin American countries of particular interest to SDC the opportunity of a high quality college education with excellent employment chances in fields that are relevant for rural development, food security and adaptation to climate change. (2) Influence the policy of the Pan American School – EAP Zamorano – with regard to improved access of poor students, greater country diversity and better gender balance. It is assumed, that the graduates with high professional and ethical qualities will make professional careers that produce positive effects on leadership capacities in the public, private and CSO sectors for sustainable rural development in beneficiary countries. This will indirectly contribute to more socially responsible agri-business behavior, better responses to challenges such as rural poverty reduction, climate change adaptation and food security.
